As of the 2010 census the city had a total [[population]] of 84,246. ==Geography== According to the City of Allen, the city has a total area of {{convert|27.1|sqmi|km2}}. None of the area is covered with [[water]] except the small ponds scattered throughout the city. ==Climate== Allen is considered to be part of the [[Humid continental climate|humid continental]] region, meaning it experiences mild to very cold winter with temperatures in winter ranging from {{convert|21|to|43|F|C}} in daytime and {{convert|8|to|30|F|C}} at nighttime. In spring the city has severe thunderstorms and mild warm days; temperatures range from {{convert|50|to|70|F|C}} in daytime and {{convert|37|to|57|F|C}} at night. In summer the city experiences very hot days ranging from {{convert|90|to|100|F|C}}. In the autumn the daytime temperatures vary from about {{convert|85|to|40|F|C}}. ==Demographics== As of the 2010 Census, the city had a population of 84,246 people. The racial makeup of the city was 64.9% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 8.4% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.5% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 13.9% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.1% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 2.9% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.7% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 16.2% of the population. There were 14,205 households out of which 55.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 74.6% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 7.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 15.2% were non-families. 11.9% of all households were made up of individuals and 1.6% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.07 and the average family size was 3.35. In the city the population was spread out with 34.9% under the age of 18, 5.4% from 18 to 24, 40.7% from 25 to 44, 16.2% from 45 to 64, and 2.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 31 years. For every 100 females there were 99.7 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 97.3 males. The median income for a household in the city in 2007 was $93,392, and the median income for a family was $100,736. ==History== The Allen area was previously home to the [[Caddo]], [[Comanche]], and other indigenous peoples. The first immigrants from the United States and Europe arrived in the early 1840s.{{cite web |url=http://www.cityofallen.org/living_here/history.htm |title=History |publisher=City of Allen |accessdate=2011-07-13}} The town was established by the Houston and Central Texas Railroad and named in 1872 for Ebenezer Allen, a state politician and railroad promoter.{{cite web |url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/hfa04 |title=Allen, TX |first=David |last=Minor |work=[[Handbook of Texas]] Online |publisher=Texas State Historical Association |accessdate=2011-07-13}} The railroad allowed crops to be sold across the country before rotting, causing a shift from the previous cattle-based agriculture.{{Cite episode |title=A Short History of Allen, Texas |url=http://www.cityofallen.org/departments/public_media_relations/allen_city_television/ |accessdate=2011-07-13 |series=Tales of Allen |credits=Gilliam, Burton (narrator); Keener, Tom (history compiler); Kaufmann, Mark (director and editor) |network=Allen City Television |airdate=2003 |time=4:01â4:42}} On February 22, 1878, a gang led by [[Sam Bass]] committed in Allen what is said to be Texas's first train robbery. From 1908 through 1948, Allen was a stop along the Texas Traction Company's [[interurban]] line from [[Denison, Texas|Denison]] to Dallas. Allen was a small town of a few hundred residents when it was incorporated in 1953. Since this time, it has grown dramatically due to the construction of [[U.S. Route 75]], the [[Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport]], and the development of nearby Dallas and [[Plano, Texas|Plano]]. ==Government== ===Local government=== According to the cityâs most recent Comprehensive Annual Financial Report, the cityâs various funds had $160.9 million in Revenues, $105.6 million in expenditures, $654.8 million in total assets, $125.6 million in total liabilities, and $42.5 million in cash and investments.[http://www.cityofallen.org/SiteContent/56/documents/Finance/2008_CAFR.pdf City of Allen CAFR] Retrieved 2009-08-17 The structure of the management and coordination of city services is: {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Allen ISD serves almost all of Allen. Small portions of the Allen city limits extend into [[Lovejoy Independent School District|Lovejoy]], [[McKinney Independent School District|McKinney]], and [[Plano Independent School District|Plano]] ISDs. In the fall of 2006, new 9th grade high school students in the Lovejoy ISD boundaries began attending the newly opened [[Lovejoy High School (Texas)|Lovejoy High School]] [http://www.dallasnews.com/sharedcontent/dws/dn/latestnews/stories/081406dnccowakelandopen.23cd566.html].
